snippet: The fiscal problems of the United States dominated meetings of the World Bank and the International Monetary Fund in Washington this weekend.
abstract: Fiscal woes of United States dominate meetings of World Bank and International Monetary Fund, as world leaders forcefully warn of consequences should US fail to raise debt ceiling and reopen its government; confidence remains that impasse will be settled before default occurs, but foreign leaders say even a near-default will lead to higher borrowing costs and slowdown of global economy.

byline.original: By ANNIE LOWREY and NATHANIEL POPPER
byline.contributor: Annie Lowrey reported from Washington, and Nathaniel Popper from New York.

lead_paragraph: The fiscal problems of the United States dominated meetings of the World Bank and the International Monetary Fund in Washington this weekend.

headline.main: World Leaders Press the U.S. on Fiscal Crisis
headline.print_headline: World Leaders Press the U.S. On Fiscal Crisis
